name: "Mischief Brew - Woodcut" - Sticker
description: Restocked a whole pile of these classics! Measures 5.5" wide by 5.25" tall.

name: Mischief Brew - "The Stone Operation" LP - Repress (Olive Green Vinyl)
description:
In a former church way outside of Philadelphia, Mischief Brew recorded "The Stone Operation" loud and fast on tour-battered gear, fiercely strummed banjos, and trashy drum kits more suited for a fairground organ. All the flare of past recordings is there: junk percussion, drunken mandolin-playing, grotesque imagery in a lyric book that strangely resembles an early edition of “Grimm’s Household Tales.” But those are just spices and ornaments, not the main dish - and the main course on “The Stone Operation” is raging hot.

Repressed on solid olive green vinyl!

name: Mischief Brew - "Rhapsody For Knives" 7"
description: Three songs that were considered for 2011's "The Stone Operation," but recorded afterwards. A barnburner, a medieval-sounding anarcho-carol (performed by The Orphans once), and a protest march! Features Tom from Meisce on fiddle. Recorded by Steve Roche at Permanent Hearing Damage, mastered by Carl Saff, pressed on blue vinyl!

name: Absinthe Rose - "The More That We Learn, The More We Learn That We're Wrong" CD
description:
ABSINTHE ROSE is a Boston based band consisting of singer songwriter Kimbo Rose on acoustic guitar and vocals and a core rhythm section of well-seasoned Boston area music veterans. The band mixes different styles of music into their own blend of Folk with a strong DIY ethic and both personal and political subject matter! The New ABSINTHE ROSE album is a split release between CURVE OF THE EARTH RECORDS, FISTOLO RECORDS, RP RECORDS, RIOTSKA RECORDS (U.K.) and the band's own label SCREECH OWL RECORDS!
“Female-led band armed with banjo and acoustic guitars writes a charging blend of what I would call rawhide country punk. Backed by a strong and powerful rhythm section, the bass and drums are what catch my attention. The guitar and other string instruments add the texture and nuances that add the color to the music. After a few listens, I was moved and captivated!” (Donofthedead) RAZORCAKE #59

name: Mischief Brew - "The Stone Operation" CD
description: In a former church way outside of Philadelphia, Mischief Brew recorded "The Stone Operation" loud and fast on tour-battered gear, fiercely strummed banjos, and trashy drum kits more suited for a fairground organ. All the flare of past recordings is there: junk percussion, drunken mandolin-playing, grotesque imagery in a lyric book that strangely resembles an early edition of “Grimm’s Household Tales.” But those are just spices and ornaments, not the main dish - and the main course on “The Stone Operation” is raging hot.

name: Mischief Brew - "Partners In Crime #2" 4-way Split 7"
description: Featuring Mischief Brew, Wingnut Dishwasher's Union, Endless Mike and the Beagle Club and Guitar Bomb, this 4-way split 7" has all four corners covered. Split-released by Fistolo (PA) and Crafty (NYC), this is a nice sampling of friends and bands that continue to cross paths in this zany vibrant underworld of DIY punk rock.

name: Mischief Brew - "Jobs In Steeltown" 7"
description: Two gritty, bluesy, somber ditties about the ups and downs of decay. The a-side ("Jobs in Steeltown") paints a grey picture of working class towns robbed of their work... yet that is only the first verse and feeble "revitalization" attempts follow. The b-side ("The Barrel") is for anyone that loves the sight of weeds growing through pavement cracks. Or, old lengths of wood found in old barns. Or, vacant lots turned into gardens. The list goes on.

name: Guignol & Mischief Brew - "Fight Dirty" CD
description: "Fight Dirty" is seven Mischief Brew songs with Guignol as backing band; six Guignol songs with Erik on guitar; a Django Reinhardt cover, and a barn-burning take on Iron Maiden's "Hallowed Be They Name" (with Slavic Soul Party's Ben Holmes on trumpet). This is not a split. It's Guignol & Mischief Brew playing together as a five-piece band. It's apotheosis anthems for the carnies, the travelers, the gypsies, jazzmen, and lowlifes; singing Turkish-flavored reveries, odes to tax evasion, dirty tricks, and mob revolution; cumbia carols, sludge-metal reels, and a funeral march at a flooded bar.

name: "The Orphans" - Sticker
description: Brand new red & black Orphans sticker! Measures 5.5" wide by 1 3/8" tall.

name: "Pirate Pug" - Sticker
description: Anyone that's ever seen our traveling salvation show knows that when we roll up to a venue, it's not unlikely for a pack of pugs to emerge from the vehicle. Pictured is Tigger, the one-eyed Frenchie/Pug mix. This was Sticker Guy's sticker of the week back when we made it! Measures 4.25 X 4.25 inches.

name: Stockyard Stoics/The Filaments - "The Special Relationship" Split 7"
description: Final recorded offering from two great bands--the UK's ska punk upstarts The Filaments and US political street punks Stockyard Stoics. Three aggressive songs from both bands, covering the topical gamut from the Christian Right to class issues in the punk scene. No bullshit DIY punk rock.

name: Witch Hunt - "Blood-Red States" CD
description: Witch Hunt’s definitive second LP, an absolute ten-song rager. This Philadelphia band bring not only a line-up change (with Rob moving to guitar and new drummer Vince joining up), but a louder, heavier, grittier, crustier, and more pissed off sound.  Ten tracks that blast over you like a burning locomotive then leave you for dead.  “Blood-Red States” shows the growth of this band, both musically and lyrically… recorded in West Philly by Steve Roche at Permanent Hearing Damage.

name: Bread & Roses - "Deep River Day" CD w/STICKER!
description:
After countless demos, random recordings, and a split 7" with Mischief Brew, Boston-based rebel-folk orchestra Bread & Roses have finally graced us with a full-length CD! Traditional olde tyme instrumentation (mandolin, upright bass, banjo, dobro, fiddle, stomping...) with a strong punk spirit, recorded DIY-style in an old church, amazing artwork on a digipak, and tributes to Utah Phillips and Merle Haggard. Get drunk and stomp along...
Free circular sticker included!!

name: Can Kickers - "Live At Lavazone" CD
description: In January 2007, New London, Connecticut's old-timey punk trio The Can Kickers embarked on a U.S. tour, their first show in Philadelphia. It was recorded in an all ages DIY radical space filled with drunken punks, stomping and screaming to fiddle, banjo, and drums. Old-timey, bluegrass, country...whatever you wanna call it, this is punk rock. And the first Fistolo release to feature a jawharp.

name: Meisce - "Shipwrecked In A Bottle" CD
description: File under "ANARCHO-CELTIC-PUNK"! Seattle's Meisce ("mesh-key-ah") formed October 2002, a seven-piece collective featuring members of Wormwood, Inhaste, Countdown to Armageddon, and Slightly Less Than Nothing. The result is a mix of Irish folk, klezmer, gypsy music... all with a heavy crust/punk influence. A follow-up to the "Bored of the Dance" 7", "Shipwrecked in a Bottle" is rollicking and festive for Pogues and Tossers fans - yet perfectly pissed off and beautifully dark. Lately, you might see Tom (fiddler) on stage with Mischief Brew.

name: Meisce - "Bored Of The Dance" 7"
description: Seattle-based crusty gritty punk n' folk with Gypsy, Celtic, and Eastern European influences. This band contains members of Countdown to Armageddon, Wormwood, Inhaste, and Slightly Less Than Nothing. Songs for drinking with friends and slaying the bastards all at once. A split release with Aborted Society Records.

name: Mutiny - "Co-Op Brewery" CD
description: The newest recording from Melbourne, Australia's Mutiny...and what a fine one it is. From soup kitchens to smoky bars, co-operatively run breweries to prison cells, these rogues know how to tell a gritty story within a song. Folk punk for punk folk recommended for fans of The Pogues, The Clash, Flogging Molly and Swingin' Utters.

name: Mutiny - "Rum Rebellion" CD
description: This is a special repackaged, rereleased version of Mutiny's "Rum Rebellion"...the band's only full-length CD to date. Australian folk punk for punk folk. Squatters sing songs about busking, bootlegging and baklava.

name: Guignol/Nanuchka - "Drink The Best Wine First" CDEP
description: Not so much a traditional split as a collaboration by two World/Inferno Friendship Society sideshows! This is klezmer for Coney Island fire-breathers, sea-shanties for grease-painted gutterballs, and jazz for punk kids that joined the circus. Guest vocals by Jack Terricloth.

name: Franz Nicolay - "Major General" LP
description: Franz Nicolay is that dapper, mustachioed multi-instrumentalist and man-about-town you’ve seen with such groups as The Hold Steady and World/Inferno Friendship Society. On "Major General," he steps up to the spotlight with a melodramatic grab-bag of full-throated songs, stories, and days of wine & roses; shamelessly strident, stentorian and more than a little sentimental. "Major General" is rich with tales of punk-rock disillusionment, redemption, nostalgic regret, ruthless self-interrogations & reinvention, and defiant yet affectionate apologies. It’s a new look for the stylishly vaudevillian jack-of-all-trades with the Jimmy Durante and death’s-head-accordion tattoos. A new stop on a hobo’s-trail of intelligent, incisive hedonism that’s taken him through anarcho-circus punk, Balkan-gypsy, new chamber music, and anthemic classic rock. LIGHT BLUE VINYL!
